repnme.cdata!:
Albania - Second Irrigation and Drainage
            Rehabilitation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall ratings suggest a satisfactory
            project outcome, likely sustainability, and substantial
            institutional development impacts. Lessons drawn from the
            project are suggested as follows. The project success is
            indeed attributable to the use of the 'Project
            Management Unit' (PMU), which had an autonomous status
            under the Albanian Law. The PMU was able to attract
            competent and committed professionals. In addition, the PMU
            was able to minimize political interference, and facilitate
            the development of water user associations (WUAs), which in
            principle devolved the irrigation responsibilities from the
            Ministry of Agriculture and Food (MoAF) to farmers (WUAs).
            However, the implementation of the project through the PMU
            left the line MoAF without any capacity. This is becoming a
            major risk to the sustainability of project impacts. At
            project completion, a discussion started as to how best
            utilize the PMU's expertise to improve MoAF's
            capacity and governance. The project also highlighted the
            importance of providing infrastructure investment in
            parallel to institutional reform. The investment not only
            facilitated the WUAs' irrigation operation, and
            improved service delivery; but also positively influenced
            farmers' views on WUA development, encouraging their
            own managerial responsibilities. Moreover, the success of
            the project is due partly to its strong community
            participation approach, where sub-projects were selected
            based on farmers' up-front commitment to irrigation.
            Finally, the project also suggested that an incremental
            approach to monitoring and evaluation (M&E), starting
            with a simple M&E system that would gradually develop
            into a more complex one, can be effective in the long-run.

repnme.cdata!:
Albania - Second Irrigation and Drainage
            Rehabilitation Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objectives of the Second
            Irrigation and Drainage Rehabilitation Project are to
            support the sustainable and equitable use of agriculture
            production. There are four project components. The first,
            rehabilitates and improves irrigation facilities, flood
            control and drainage facilities, and irrigation reservoirs
            and headworks, as well as supporting field surveys, project
            design, and construction supervision. The second component
            continues support provided under the first project for
            developing a sustainable irrigation sub-sector by 1)
            strengthening and expanding the transfer of irrigation
            management to water users' associations; 2) assisting
            the restructuring of water enterprises into more sustainable
            institutions responsive to their users; and 3) assisting the
            construction industry to encourage better contract practices
            and construction quality. The third component improves
            irrigation technologies like gate and pump station design,
            develops design manuals, commissions sector studies, and
            conducts annual dam inspections. It also improves
            environmental management by piloting the communal management
            of micro-catchments, training farmers in best agricultural
            practices and extension services, and funding environmental
            monitoring. The fourth component supports project
            implementation including developing an investment program.

repnme.cdata!:
Albania - Second Irrigation and Drainage
            Rehabilitation Project : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This study reviews the environmental
            impact on the eight irrigation and drainage subprojects
            under the Second Irrigation and Drainage Rehabilitation
            Project in Albania. It analyzes the relatively narrow
            environmental impact of the proposed irrigation
            rehabilitation, emphasizing a wider impact on the
            surrounding environment, since the long-term impact on the
            subprojects' viability is of higher relevance. The
            study includes eight volumes, considering, in general,
            positive assessments on the impacts of the rehabilitation of
            deteriorated irrigation and drainage facilities. In
            particular, the rehabilitation will restore efficient
            irrigation and increase farm incomes among an impoverished
            rural population. Drainage will facilitate growth in the
            cooler months, reducing fertilizer and agro-chemical
            run-offs. However, soil erosion from surrounding areas is a
            major environmental concern, and it is expected to be
            addressed through the proposed watershed management
            component. This component will also address the soil
            salinity issue, which, even though salinity may not be
            present in most subproject areas, adjacent slope watershed
            areas may contain infertile acid soils, conducive to poor
            quality vegetation and high erosion degrees. To mitigate
            these impacts, the study suggests the need for irrigation
            and water quality to be monitored annually. Drainage water
            samples should be analyzed for pesticide residues.

Albania - Second Irrigation and Drainage

441532.trustfund:
TF029407-PHRD-TOURISM II/URBAN UPGRADING/,TF021259-PHRD 2 - IN DEPTH REVIEW OF THE
            PERFORMANCE & IMPACT OF THE,TF040058-ALBANIA - 2ND IRRIGATION AND

repnme.cdata!:
Albania - Second Irrigation and Drainage
            Rehabilitation Project : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This study reviews the environmental
            impact on the eight irrigation and drainage subprojects
            under the Second Irrigation and Drainage Rehabilitation
            Project in Albania. It analyzes the relatively narrow
            environmental impact of the proposed irrigation
            rehabilitation, emphasizing a wider impact on the
            surrounding environment, since the long-term impact on the
            subprojects' viability is of higher relevance. The
            study includes eight volumes, considering, in general,
            positive assessments on the impacts of the rehabilitation of
            deteriorated irrigation and drainage facilities. In
            particular, the rehabilitation will restore efficient
            irrigation and increase farm incomes among an impoverished
            rural population. Drainage will facilitate growth in the
            cooler months, reducing fertilizer and agro-chemical
            run-offs. However, soil erosion from surrounding areas is a
            major environmental concern, and it is expected to be
            addressed through the proposed watershed management
            component. This component will also address the soil
            salinity issue, which, even though salinity may not be
            present in most subproject areas, adjacent slope watershed
            areas may contain infertile acid soils, conducive to poor
            quality vegetation and high erosion degrees. To mitigate
            these impacts, the study suggests the need for irrigation
            and water quality to be monitored annually. Drainage water
            samples should be analyzed for pesticide residues.

docna.cdata!:
Albania - Second Irrigation and Drainage
            Rehabilitation Project : environmental assessment

            (Vol. 5)
